snippet: The French hosts of a meeting to coordinate assistance to the Iraqi fight against Islamist militants have not ruled out Iran’s attendance, but the United States is arguing against the country’s inclusion.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry says it would not be appropriate for Iran to attend international conference on security crisis in Iraq to be held in Paris; France, which is host of meeting, has left open possibility that Iran might attend and help coordinate aid to new Iraqi government for its fight against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu and Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The French hosts of a meeting to coordinate assistance to the Iraqi fight against Islamist militants have not ruled out Iran’s attendance, but the United States is arguing against the country’s inclusion.

headline.main: Iran’s Participation in Meeting to Aid Iraq Is ‘Not Appropriate,’ Says Kerry
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Participation in Meeting to Aid Iraq Is ‘Not Appropriate,’ Says Kerry

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
